intro: Dorstenia poinsettiifolia var. librevillensis, commonly known as the Libreville dwarf banana, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is typically grown as a houseplant due to its compact size and ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
